name: horace_lung
text: I can hardly believe its been three and half years since the Kidnapped Phillipe story arc: the suspense captured in this strip still holds.

name: tekende
text: To anyone reading this arc for the first time, I recommend you skip the comments on this strip and come back after finishing the arc, as there are several spoilers below.

name: haroldzidler
text: Good lookin' out.

name: launisch
text: Thanks for the warning.  You're making the world a better place.

name: shinkusan
text: Yeah, this arc is genius. I was genuinely terrified for Philippe, even though death in Achewood means little unless you find true love through it. This strip should be made into a few short films. Problem is, I would declare ANY voice actors cast to be the wrong voices.

name: morganization
text: A comment left by morganization was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by jaredwilde, hellofyellin, wurlitzergirl, Spenham, rascaldom, _cheesekayke, Sweetlips, dinner, cailetshadow, JoulesIsEnergy, LRosetw8)

name: syrinx
text: Despite all of the tragedy of it, the image of a sad Phillipe in a bee costume is so fucking cute.

name: prolefeed5
text: I love how Phillipe is so even-keeled about hitting a deer considering how innocently sensitive he is about so many other things... I definitely underestimated the wickedness of his sack.

name: carlyle
text: He hasn't yet taken the ramifications in. He was about to start sobbing before Nice Pete(?) shot him.

name: djwhiterabbit
text: dark.

name: centipede_damascus
text: click. blam.

name: clembot
text: A comment left by clembot was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by implode, catgrl131, CanusDivinus, theplaidknight, The_Stoned_One)

name: rogergs
text: A comment left by rogergs was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by nbgreene, sirhan_duran, catgrl131, Kelly, theplaidknight, Jyuu, The_Stoned_One, excusemesenator)

name: jesler729
text: Yes. It is.

name: jyuu
text: Thanks for ruining the suspense!

name: kledermans
text: The problem is, the profile actually changes in the next strip.  It doesn't look like Ray here, and it doesn't look like Nice Pete in the next one.  A cool trick, though; you don't notice it the first time.

name: augeno13
text: it's close enough that i'm not gonna call shenanigans

name: thatcrazycommie
text: I like to think we're seeing it from Philippe's perspective in this one, and Ray's silhouette looks enough like Nice Pete that Phillipe sees it that way.

name: philosophe
text: The blam explodes out of the panel

name: ocarinak
text: The saddest thing.

name: billylk
text:
Chris Ware?

He's trying to get away...

...I guess I would too

name: clockworkorange
text: Deer don't bite, deer are soft and friendly

name: dovey
text: Sadder than Bill Watterson's dead bird.

name: johnnybaverage
text: That is some serious avatar/comment dissonance you've got going on there.

name: saint
text: I love how he first seems so remorseful, but it's quickly followed up with "stupid deer!" It's like saying, "I'm so sorry you're a fucking retard."

name: ibetso
text: Nah I think that's a natural response from him. "Goddammit why did you have to have to run onto the road" is probably the first thing said by anyone who ever hit an animal with their car.

name: zem
text: especially when they're panicked and trying to get away from nice pete

name: peterjoel
text:
The first time I read this strip, I think I read it out of sequence, so I did not fully appreciated the ambiguity of the silhouetted figure firing a gun. The terror on Philippe's face could just as easily be the terror of watching Nice Pete pointing a gun at him as the terror of watching Ray's act of mercy.

Of course, Nice Pete would not stoop to murdering with guns. Not classy.

name: markrowe
text: Looking back, this is one of the best short stories, so much done with simple sound and shade.  The last two panels are terrifying.

name: c_dizzle
text: Damn Onstad and Philippe for making me cry.

name: envika
text: OHHHHH SHIIIIIIIIIIIT

name: lobster_mobster
text: I half shit myself when I read this at first... I seriously thought Phillippe had died... I still get shivers just from the memory. It seems just like Phillippe that his final weakness would be his compassion for the deer. Thank God it was Ray.

name: catgrl131
text: Please people! Don't ruin the story for people going through the archives!

name: sex_bicycle
text: i agree but thank god some guy up there commented so this wonderful arc wouldn't be ruined >.< i think this is probably my favourite arc to date it's pure briliance

name: wite_rabit
text: Why? Characters have died more than once already - it isn't as though death really has a hold on anyone other than squirrels.

name: kingcrimson
text: And apparently deer

name: skaterpix
text: Poor Deer! Poor Philippe! Poor Car!

name: hatcatrat
text: I love ham

name: poodlelucy
text: the struggling, dying deer made my heart hurt.

name: nice-on-water
text: I think those lines "He's trying to get away...I guess I would too" are the saddest, introspective and somber in this entire comic and are only rivaled by Beef walking alone under the streetlights, thinking about marriage.

name: nice-on-water
text: Most introspective* FUCK

name: wite_rabit
text: Comment/avatar work perfectly. Chubby.

name: nice-on-water
text: KISS MY ASS , bad grammar!

name: wite_rabit
text: Screw you, bad grammar! FUCK YOU!

name: gunsofray
text: not that anyone cares, but this the first Achewood i read, and my favourite ever since

name: redmange
text:
I'm going to get in a lot of trouble for this...

But I rated this strip a 1. I rate strips by nothing else but how I look when I read them. This is the only strip ((To my recall)) that I've ever given a 1. Because it makes me sob. So many emotions are perfectly captured in this strip, and it shakes me to my very core.
